sentence.Network_en: He vowed to wreak vengeance on his unfaithful, thieving wife.
sentence.Network_cn: 他发誓要报复对自己不忠、爱偷东西的妻子。

sentence.Network_en: Stress can wreak havoc on the immune system.
sentence.Network_cn: 压力可能会破坏免疫系统。

sentence.Network_en: Their policies would wreak havoc on the economy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的政策将对经济造成巨大的破坏。

list.abs: singled out 挑出，选出wreaks mayhem 犯下重伤罪-
希高翻译-医学词汇中英对照一 ... 经诊断个案 diagnosed case 肆虐 wreak havoc 腺病毒 adenovirus.
Book 4 ... to wreak vengeance 报复 wreak havoc （对 ……）造成严重破坏 play havoc with （ 对……）造成严重破坏.
the earthquake wreaked havoc on the city ., 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wrecan 'drive (out), avenge', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wreken and German rächen; compare with wrack, wreck, and wretch

entry.def: Something or someone that wreaks havoc or destruction causes a great amount of disorder or damage.

example.ex: Violent storms wreaked havoc on the French Riviera, leaving three people dead and dozens injured...
example.tran: 猛烈的暴风雨给法国里维埃拉地区造成了极大的破坏，致使三人死亡，数十人受伤。

example.ex: The mountains are studded with dams, any one of which could wreak destruction in the valley below.
example.tran: 山区到处都是大坝，其中任何一个都可能给下面的山谷带来灭顶之灾。

entry.def: If you wreak revenge or vengeance on someone, you do something that will harm them very much to punish them for the harm they have done to you.

example.ex: He threatened to wreak vengeance on the men who toppled him a year ago.
example.tran: 他威胁要对一年前扳倒他的人进行报复。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to happen or to occur as a consequence;

sentences.sentence: "The rain brought relief to the drought-stricken area"

sentences.en: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.cn: 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。

sentences.en: She is determined to wreak vengeance on those who killed her cousin.
sentences.cn: 她决心要向杀害表妹的凶手报仇。
